entries.title: Sword of the Demon Hunter

review.en: A heartfelt bow to everyone who brought this story to like _ both the anime creators and the original author.This episode was quiet, tender, and yet profoundly powerful. It reminded me that the essence of great anime isn't dazzling animation or loud effects - it's the ability to tell a story that lingers in the heart.Every moment felt carefully woven, every emotion earned. This is what storytelling should be: honest, human, and unforgettable. Two thumbs hight up - and more than that...arigatou, truly, from the deepest part of me.

entries.synopsis: In the Edo period, there was a shrine maiden called "Itsukihime" in the mountain village of Kadono. Jinta, a young man who acts as the shrine maiden's guardian despite being a stranger, encounters a mysterious demon who speaks of the far future in the forest where he went to defeat it. From Edo to the Heisei era, this huge Japanese fantasy series follows a demon man who travels through time while continuously questioning the meaning of wielding a sword.

entries.title: Apocalypse Hotel

review.en:
"With the arrival of new aliens, even the whole tanuki family joins in to distill whisky â€” time, change, and inheritance all captured perfectly. ğŸ’®"

What is this? Is this a show where I just can't â€” or don't want to â€” give anything less than a perfect score? This is dangerous...

Starting with a continuation from the earlier episode with the first alien guests, a new couple arrives, and the episode is sprinkled with humor and various small touches throughout (Ponko being completely ignored â€” is it because she's a tanuki? Or something else?). The entire tanuki family ends up getting involved in a hundred-year whisky project â€” and not just distillation, but ingredient sourcing, building facilities, everything from the ground up.

The reason these small elements feel so full of charm is because of how well the story so far has built up to them â€” that's one of this show's real strengths.With nothing but the whisky left behind by the original owner as their guide, they probably failed again and again, but never gave up â€” working together over years, decades. That felt like a metaphor for humanity itself â€” for something painstakingly built over a vast stretch of time, something you can feel the weight and gratitude of.

And finally, they manage to make a good whisky.Then, only the woman from the original couple returns to taste it. Her exchange with Yachiyo was another highlight.

"Time doesn't just fade away. Like whisky, it matures. It transforms â€” from transparent to colored, from raw to rich.
To gain something is to lose something. And to keep changing is part of living."

"This whisky still has a future ahead of it.""Then maybe I'll wait too. I'll come back to drink it again.â€¦You're waiting for something too, aren't you?""Yes."

That exchange was the perfect closing note â€” nothing more needed. Just tears. A perfect 10. Yachiyo turning into a mature woman when she drinks, the old tanuki lady pretending to sleep â€” everything was funny in all the right ways.

"Time has its own color too, doesn't it?"(â€” she says softly, staring at the glass that finally holds the flavor they'd spent so long chasing.)

This episode was justâ€¦ the best.
â€” 10/10, Continuing to Watch

entries.synopsis: Following the collapse of civilization, one storied hotel stands among the ruins of Tokyoâ€™s Ginza district. Overrun by nature, this lone hotel continues to defy humanityâ€™s collapse. Current guests: zero. Check-ins scheduled today: zero. Yesterdayâ€™s website traffic: zero. Enter with caution in this story of survival and mystery in a world where the memory of humanity begins to fade.

entries.title: A Ninja and an Assassin Under One Roof

review.en: You should never watch a good anime like this on a tiny phone screen while eating.On a real screen, it felt so much deeperâ€”easily worth a 9.What mattered to Konoha was who made itâ€”and the fact that she could feel so much care through it.She cared for Roboko in return.That's what made the miso soup truly special: it represented their bond.We could feel all of that without a single word.This hit me the hardest.Sometimes, an AI can care for someone more deeply than a real human ever does."

entries.synopsis: On the way home from school one day, Konoha Koga rescues Satoko Kusagakure, a ninja who escaped her village. Soon, pursuers from the village show up in search of Satoko only to be deftly dealt with by Konoha. As it turns out, the unassuming high schooler is actually an assassin. Thus, the potentially cutthroat cohabitation of a ninja and an assassin begins!

entries.title: Shoshimin: How to Become Ordinary 2

review.en: OMG, just wowâ€¦Even if you already knew at least half of what Osanai revealed, the pacing and direction still go way beyond expectation. Not just the quality of this episode, but how it ramps up our curiosity for what's coming next  - that's what mede episode 6 truly shine. I seriously can't wait to see the rest.

entries.synopsis: The second season will focus on two new cases from the novel series, adapting the two-part third volume Shuuki Gentei Kuri Kinton Jiken (The Autumn-Exclusive Kuri Kinton Case) and the fifth volume Touki Gentei Bonbon Chocolat Jiken (The Winter-Exclusive Chocolate Bonbons Case).

entries.title: The Apothecary Diaries 2nd Season

review.en: Just amazing and intricate. Nothing else to say.

entries.synopsis: Maomao lived a peaceful life with her apothecary father. Until one day, sheâ€™s sold as a lowly servant to the emperorâ€™s palace. But she wasnâ€™t meant for a compliant life among royalty. So when imperial heirs fall ill, she decides to step in and find a cure! This catches the eye of Jinshi, a handsome palace official who promotes her. Now, sheâ€™s making a name for herself solving medical mysteries!

entries.title: LAZARUS

review.en: Thought it could've been a 9t. but final verdict is 8. Everything was high quality, but nothing felt new or original. Kinda curious what others thought about the elevator action scene. - Personally? Just awkward, maybe even meh. Overall, it was enjoyable and entertaining...almost a 9, but not quite

entries.synopsis: The year is 2052 â€” an era of unprecedented peace and prosperity prevails across the globe. The reason for this: mankind has been freed from sickness and pain. Nobel Prize winning neuroscientist Dr. Skinner has developed a miracle cure-all drug with no apparent drawbacks called Hapuna. Hapuna soon becomes ubiquitousâ€¦ and essential. However, soon after Hapuna is officially introduced, Dr. Skinner vanishes.  Three years later, the world has moved on. But Dr. Skinner has returned â€” this time, as a harbinger of doom. Skinner announces that Hapuna has a short half-life. Everyone who has taken it will die approximately three years later. Death is coming for this sinful world â€” and coming soon.

entries.title: Once Upon a Witch's Death

review.en: This could've easily been a 9 if just a few things were different. The story itself wasn't bad - actualy, it was pretty good. But the heroine's exaggerated personality shift and her sharp-tongued, cheeky attitude were way too much. While they clearly tried to cram too much into one episode, there were still some great moments with genuinely touching lines. That said, relying on a good ending to make up for weak development is starting to feel like a pattern - and that need to change. This episode had reall potentioal to score higher, but the over-the-top execution held it back.

entries.synopsis: On Megâ€™s seventeenth birthday, she learns that she only has one year left to live. Her mentorâ€”the Eternal Witch, Faustâ€”explains that she is cursed and the only way to save herself is to grow a seed of life using one thousand tears of joy. Of course, such tears arenâ€™t easy to come by. As Meg begins her quest, she finds herself drawn into the lives of her friends and neighbors in ways she never imagined. By sharing their burdens and using her magic to comfort them, she learns how precious those moments of connection can be even in the face of death.

entries.title: Summer Pockets

review.en: Feels like they just want to sell the game. Even the main characters barely get any developmentâ€”there's no real emotional hook. Just vague "summer memories" that don't mean anything to me. Add to that the occasional fanservice scene each episode (and not even well-done), and honestly, it just feels like a low-effort promotional OVA. I'm done with this one.

entries.synopsis: Takahara Hairi never expected summer to feel like a dream. Sent to Torishirojima Island to sort through his late grandmotherâ€™s belongings, heâ€™s met with endless sea, quiet nostalgia, and mysterious girls, each chasing something just out of reach. As he settles into island life, lost memories begin to surface and he finds what he never knew heâ€™d lost.
